Dynamic multinuclear sites formed by mobilized copper ions in NOx selective catalytic reduction (Science, 2017, 357, 898-903)
Benchmark First-Principles Calculations of Adsorbate Free Energies (ACS Catal., 2018, 8, 1945-1954)
Zeolite Adsorption Free Energies from ab Initio Potentials of Mean Force (J. Chem. Theory Comput., 2018, 14, 929-938)
Experimental and Computational Interrogation of Fast SCR Mechanism and Active Sites on H‑Form SSZ-13 (ACS Catal., 2017, 7, 5087-5096)
Adsorption Energy Correlations at the Metal−Support Boundary (ACS Catal., 2017, 7, 4707-4715)
Previous Next

Our research centers on problems involving zeolites for NOx reduction, catalysis at metal surfaces, catalysis for shale gas, and energy-directed catalysis.

Browse our principal investigator, lab members, publications, photos, resources and available positions to learn more.

For more information on chemical engineering and chemistry at Notre Dame, visit the Department of Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering and the Department of Chemistry & Biochemistry.
